Qualifiers.Scope: Lot coverage describes how much of the lot is covered by structures.
Exclusions: Uncovered structures less than 30” above grade.

Usage parameters: Footprints of all structures including main residence, covered parking, tool sheds, covered pool equipment units.
Projecting elements such as balconies, stairways, porches, patio covers.
Roof overhangs or eaves that exceed 4’.
Swimming pools and spas that exceed 30” above grade.

Mandatory: Lot coverage must not exceed 35% of the lot size.
Optional: An additional 5% coverage is permitted for covered patios, canopies and roof overhangs beyond 4 feet.
Conditional logic: To qualify as a structure that is less than 30 inches above grade, a porch or deck may only have open railings above 30 inches—no solid half walls.

Explicit deviations: An additional 5% coverage is permitted for covered patios, canopies and roof overhangs beyond 4 feet.

Qualifiers.Scope: Gross floor area describes the mass of the structures by reflecting the cumulative square footage of all visible levels.
Qualifiers.Applicability: All floors in a main structure and accessory buildings.

Dimensional.Name: Gross floor area ratio
Dimensional.Value: 45% of the first 5,000 sf plus 30% of any portion of lot area in excess of 5,000 sf

Usage parameters: The sum of all the floors in a main structure measured to the outside of the exterior stud walls.
Stairwells at all floors and all areas that are greater than 50% enclosed and covered.
Covered parking and all accessory buildings which are greater than 120 square feet.
Spaces that meet the criteria for second and third floor equivalents.

Mandatory: Gross floor area must not exceed the calculated allowable area based on the lot size.

Explicit deviations: The main house may not exceed 6,000 sf, regardless of the size of the lot.
